description:
At the Morrison & Hughes Law Firm in LaGrange, Georgia, we strive to provide the highest level of advocacy and support possible to those who suffered a serious injury or lost a loved one on the job or due to the negligent, reckless and unlawful actions of others. With three offices throughout the greater Atlanta metro, we have become one of our area's most prominent law firms for those dealing with complex, pressing legal challenges involving any of the following:

  • Wrongful Death
  • Trucking Accidents
  • Personal injury
  • Car accidents
  • Construction Injuries and Accidents
  • Workers' compensation
  • Social Security Disability
  • Wage and overtime disputes

Combined, our attorneys have decades of legal experience, and we have received numerous awards and honors from our peers for our outstanding professionalism and service, including two attorneys who are AV Preeminent peer-review rated* through Martindale-Hubbell. Perhaps more importantly, we have also received many accolades from our satisfied clients, including Superb client ratings on Avvo as well as the Platinum Client Champion Award from Martindale-Hubbell.

Our success is the direct result of our extensive experience and our unwavering dedication to those we serve coupled with our utilization of the latest in legal technology to present the most compelling case possible to help our clients recover the maximum amount of compensation they deserve.

To find out more about how we can best serve your needs at the Morrison & Hughes Law Firm, you can contact our law office or visit our website to schedule a free case evaluation. We also offer virtual consultations so that you do not have to risk your health and safety to speak with us.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
